description: The QRF segment is used with the QRD segment to further refine the content of an original style query

1.name: Where Subject Filter
1.description: This field identifies the department, system, or subsystem to which the query pertains. This field may repeat as in LAB~HEMO, etc

2.name: When Data Start Date/Time
2.description: This field contains the dates and times equal to or after which this value should be included

3.name: When Data End Date/Time
3.description: This field contains the dates and times equal to or before which this date should be included

4.name: What User Qualifier
4.description: This field contains an identifier to further define characteristics of the data of interest

5.name: Other QRY Subject Filter
5.description: This field contains a filter defined locally for use between two systems. This filter uses codes and field definitions which have specific meaning only to the applications and/or site involved

6.name: Which Date/Time Qualifier
6.description: This field specifies the type of date referred to in QRF-2-when data start date/time and QRF-3when data end date/time
6.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

7.name: Which Date/Time Status Qualifier
7.description: This field specifies the status type of objects selected in date range defined by QRF-2-when data start date/time and QRF-3-when data end date/time).
7.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

8.name: Date/Time Selection Qualifier
8.description: This field allows the specification of certain types of values within the date/time range
8.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

9.name: When Quantity/Timing Qualifier
9.description: This field allows an interval definition to be used for specifying multiple responses to a query. With the addition of this filter, new query specifications should no longer use QRF-2-when data start date/time and QRF-3-when data end date/time in future implementations
